qas.question: What immediately occurred after Yarsolav the Wise past away?
Who was fighting for Tmutarakan following Yarsolav's death?
What country did the fleeing Grand Prince run off to?
Where did the first federal council of Rus take place in 1097?

plausible_answers.text: the death of Yaroslav the Wise

qas.question: What did not cause a conflict of power?
Who did not contest the power of the Grand Prince?
What country did the Grand Prince avoid?
What year did the Grand Prince return to establish order?

context: The most prominent struggle for power was the <a0_0>conflict<a0_0/> that erupted after <b4_0>the death of Yaroslav the Wise<b4_0/>. The rivaling <b5_0>Principality of Polotsk<b5_0/> was contesting the power of the Grand Prince by occupying Novgorod, while <a1_0>Rostislav Vladimirovich<a1_0/> was fighting for the Black Sea port of Tmutarakan belonging to Chernihiv.[citation needed] Three of Yaroslav's sons that first allied together found themselves fighting each other especially after their defeat to the Cuman forces in <b7_0>1068<b7_0/> at the Battle of the Alta River. At the same time an uprising took place in Kiev, bringing to power Vseslav of Polotsk who supported the traditional Slavic paganism.[citation needed] The ruling Grand Prince Iziaslav fled to <a2_0><b6_0>Poland<b6_0/><a2_0/> asking for support and in couple of years returned to establish the order.[citation needed] The affairs became even more complicated by the end of the 11th century driving the state into chaos and constant warfare. On the initiative of Vladimir II Monomakh in 1097 the first federal council of Kievan Rus took place near Chernihiv]in the <a3_0>city of Liubech<a3_0/> with the main intention to find an understanding among the fighting sides. However even though that did not really stop the fighting, it certainly cooled things off.[citation needed]
